TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit X509Store extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: 証明書を永続化して管理する物理ストアである X.509 ストアを表します。 このクラスは継承できません。

remarks.format:
## 解説 Use this class to work with an X.509 store.
> [!IMPORTANT] > Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)], this type implements the <xref:System.IDisposable> interface. When you have finished using the type, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly. To dispose of the type directly, call its <xref:System.IDisposable.Dispose%2A> method in a **languageKeyword tag is not supported!!!!** > \/**languageKeyword tag is not supported!!!!** > block. To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as **languageKeyword tag is not supported!!!!** > \(in C\#\) or **languageKeyword tag is not supported!!!!** > \(in Visual Basic\). For more information, see the “Using an Object that Implements IDisposable” section in the <xref:System.IDisposable> interface topic. > > For apps that target the [!INCLUDE[net_v452](~/includes/net-v452-md.md)] and earlier versions, the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store> class does not implement the <xref:System.IDisposable> interface and therefore does not have a **languageKeyword tag is not supported!!!!** > method.
## 例 This section contains two examples. The first example demonstrates how you can open standard X.509 stores and list the number of certificates in each.
The second example demonstrates how you can add and remove single certificates and ranges of certificates.
**Example 1**
This example tries to open each standard store in each standard location on the current computer. It prints a summary that shows whether each store exists and, if so, the number of certificates it contains.
The example creates an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store> object for each combination of standard name and standard location. It calls the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store.Open%2A> method with the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.OpenFlags.OpenExistingOnly?displayProperty=fullName> flag, which opens the physical store only if it already exists. If the physical store exists, the example uses the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store.Name%2A>, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store.Location%2A>, and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store.Certificates%2A> properties to display the number of certificates in the store.
[!code-csharp[x509store2\#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CS/storenames1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[x509store2\#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/vb/storenames1.vb#2)]
**Example 2**
This example opens an X.509 certificate store, adds and deletes certificates, and then closes the store. It assumes that you have three certificates to add to and remove from a local store.
[!code-cpp[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CPP/x509store2.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CS/x509store2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/vb/x509store2.vb#1)]

remarks.format:

remarks.format:
## 解説 This method returns a snapshot of the X.509 certificate store. Note that subsequent <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store.Add%2A> or <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store.Remove%2A> operations performed on the store will not have any effect on the collection that is returned. This snapshot is recalculated each time the property is called, so the use of this property inside an iterative function is not recommended.
## 例 This section contains two examples. The first example demonstrates how you can open standard X.509 stores and list the number of certificates in each.
The second example demonstrates how you can add and remove single certificates and ranges of certificates.
**Example 1**
This example tries to open each standard store in each standard location on the current computer. It prints a summary that shows whether each store exists and, if so, the number of certificates it contains.
The example creates an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store> object for each combination of standard name and standard location. It calls the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store.Open%2A> method with the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.OpenFlags.OpenExistingOnly?displayProperty=fullName> flag, which opens the physical store only if it already exists. If the physical store exists, the example uses the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store.Name%2A>, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store.Location%2A>, and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store.Certificates%2A> properties to display the number of certificates in the store.
[!code-csharp[x509store2\#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CS/storenames1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[x509store2\#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/vb/storenames1.vb#2)]
**Example 2**
This example opens an X.509 certificate store, adds and deletes certificates, and then closes the store. It assumes that you have three certificates to add to and remove from a local store.
[!code-cpp[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CPP/x509store2.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CS/x509store2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/vb/x509store2.vb#1)]

Docs.permission: for enumerating certificates in an X.509 certificate store. Security action: . Associated enumeration:

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Close() cil managed

Docs.summary: X.509 証明書ストアを閉じます。

remarks.format:
## 解説 This method releases all resources associated with the store. You should always close an X.509 certificate store after use.
## 例 The following code example opens an X.509 certificate store, adds and deletes certificates, and then closes the store. It assumes that you have three certificates to add to and remove from a local store.
[!code-cpp[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CPP/x509store2.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CS/x509store2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/vb/x509store2.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed

Docs.summary: この が使用しているリソースを解放します。

remarks.format:
## 解説
> [!NOTE] > <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store> implements the <xref:System.IDisposable> interface starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]; in previous versions of the .NET Framework, the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store> class does not implement this interface, and therefore the `Dispose` method does not exist.

X.509 証明書ストアの場所を取得します。

remarks.format:
## 解説 This property returns the X.509 certificate store location of either the store for the current user or the store for the local computer.
## 例 This section contains two examples. The first example demonstrates how you can open standard X.509 stores and list the number of certificates in each.
The second example demonstrates how you can add and remove single certificates and ranges of certificates.
**Example 1**
This example tries to open each standard store in each standard location on the current computer. It prints a summary that shows whether each store exists and, if so, the number of certificates it contains.
The example creates an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store> object for each combination of standard name and standard location. It calls the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store.Open%2A> method with the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.OpenFlags.OpenExistingOnly?displayProperty=fullName> flag, which opens the physical store only if it already exists. If the physical store exists, the example uses the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store.Name%2A>, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store.Location%2A>, and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store.Certificates%2A> properties to display the number of certificates in the store.
[!code-csharp[x509store2\#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CS/storenames1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[x509store2\#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/vb/storenames1.vb#2)]
**Example 2**
This example opens an X.509 certificate store, adds and deletes certificates, and then closes the store. It assumes that you have three certificates to add to and remove from a local store.
[!code-cpp[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CPP/x509store2.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CS/x509store2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/vb/x509store2.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: X.509 証明書ストアの名前を取得します。

remarks.format:
## 解説 This property returns the X.509 certificate store name. This value can indicate the type of certificates stored, such as root certificates or certificates from trusted publishers.
## 例 This section contains two examples. The first example demonstrates how you can open standard X.509 stores and list the number of certificates in each.
The second example demonstrates how you can add and remove single certificates and ranges of certificates.
**Example 1**
This example tries to open each standard store in each standard location on the current computer. It prints a summary that shows whether each store exists and, if so, the number of certificates it contains.
The example creates an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store> object for each combination of standard name and standard location. It calls the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store.Open%2A> method with the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.OpenFlags.OpenExistingOnly?displayProperty=fullName> flag, which opens the physical store only if it already exists. If the physical store exists, the example uses the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store.Name%2A>, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store.Location%2A>, and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store.Certificates%2A> properties to display the number of certificates in the store.
[!code-csharp[x509store2\#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CS/storenames1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[x509store2\#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/vb/storenames1.vb#2)]
**Example 2**
This example opens an X.509 certificate store, adds and deletes certificates, and then closes the store. It assumes that you have three certificates to add to and remove from a local store.
[!code-cpp[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CPP/x509store2.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CS/x509store2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/vb/x509store2.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Open(valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.OpenFlags flags) cil managed

Docs.param: X.509 証明書ストアを開く方法を指定する列挙値のビットごとの組み合わせ。
Docs.summary: フラグの設定に応じて、X.509 証明書ストアを開くか、または新しいストアを作成します。

remarks.format:
## 解説 Use this method to open an existing X.509 store. Note that you must have additional permissions, specified by <xref:System.Security.Permissions.StorePermissionFlags>, to enumerate the certificates in the store. You can create a new store by passing a store name that does not exist to the class constructor, and then using any of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.OpenFlags> flags except <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.OpenFlags.OpenExistingOnly>.
## 例 The following code example opens an X.509 certificate store, adds and deletes certificates, and then closes the store. It assumes that you have three certificates to add to and remove from a local store.
[!code-cpp[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CPP/x509store2.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CS/x509store2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/vb/x509store2.vb#1)]

Docs.exception: ストアを読み取ることができません。
呼び出し元に、必要なアクセス許可がありません。
ストアに無効な値が含まれています。

Docs.summary: X.509 証明書ストアから証明書を削除します。

remarks.format:
## 解説 Use this method to remove a single certificate from an X.509 store.
## 例 The following code example opens an X.509 certificate store, adds and deletes certificates, and then closes the store. It assumes that you have three certificates to add to and remove from a local store.
[!code-cpp[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CPP/x509store2.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CS/x509store2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/vb/x509store2.vb#1)]

Docs.exception: 呼び出し元に、必要なアクセス許可がありません。
Docs.permission: for removing certificates from an X.509 certificate store. Security action: . Associated enumerations: ,

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RemoveRange(class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2Collection certificates) cil managed

Docs.param: 削除する証明書の範囲。
Docs.summary: X.509 証明書ストアから、ある一定の範囲の証明書を削除します。

remarks.format:
## 解説
> [!IMPORTANT] > この型は、 <xref:System.IDisposable> インターフェイスです。 型の使用が完了したらを直接または間接的にその破棄する必要があります。 型の直接 dispose を呼び出してその <xref:System.IDisposable.Dispose%2A> メソッドで、 `try`\/`catch` ブロックします。 直接ことのない破棄する場合など言語構成要素を使用して `using` \(c\#\) のまたは `Using` \(Visual Basic で\)。 詳細については、"を使用して、オブジェクトを実装して IDisposable"」セクションを参照してください、 <xref:System.IDisposable> インターフェイスに関するトピック。
このメソッドは、X.509 証明書ストアから複数の証明書を削除します。1 つの証明書の削除に失敗した場合、操作を元に戻すし、証明書は削除されません。
## 例 次のコード例は、X.509 証明書ストアを開き、追加され、証明書を削除したうえでとし、ストアを閉じます。 追加し、ローカル ストアから削除する 3 つの証明書があることを想定しています。
[!code-cpp[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CPP/x509store2.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/CS/x509store2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[x509store2\#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/x509store2/vb/x509store2.vb#1)]

Docs.exception: 呼び出し元に、必要なアクセス許可がありません。
Docs.permission: for removing certificates from an X.509 certificate store. Security action: . Associated enumerations: ,

Attribute.AttributeName: System.MonoTODO("Mono's stores are fully managed. Always returns IntPtr.Zero.")

Docs.summary: ストアを識別する ハンドルを取得します。
Docs.value: ストアを識別するハンドル。

remarks.format:
## 解説 使用して、 <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Store.StoreHandle%2A> プロパティで、アンマネージ Microsoft 暗号化 API \(CAPI\) の互換性を提供します。
詳細については、 `HCERTSTORE` アンマネージ CAPI ドキュメントの Platform SDK セクションを参照して、処理、 [MSDN Library](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37118)します。
## 例

Docs.exception: ストアは開いていません。
Docs.permission: for unmanaged code. Security action: . Associated enumeration:
